Name: Aagenaes syndrome
Synonyms_List__c: CHLS, Cholestasis lymphedema syndrome, LCS, LCS1, Lymphedema cholestasis syndrome
Disease_Description__c: A rare genetic syndrome which occurs primarily among individuals of Norwegian descent with an autosomal recessive pattern of inheritance. It is caused, in some cases, by the inheritance of a mutation of the LSC1 gene on chromosome 15. Clinical signs include lymphedema of the lower extremities and cholestasis. The clinical course includes giant-cell hepatitis and progression to cirrhosis.
